title: Aeneid 6 325-329 - The Sibyl describes the Styx

content.question:
The Sibyl describes the Styx to Aeneas.

Haec omnis, quam cernis,cerno, -ere: see inopsinops, inopis, adj.: needy, wretched inhumataqueinhumatus, -a, -um, adj.: unburied turba est;
 portitorportitor, -oris, m.: boatman, ferryman ille Charon; hi, quos vehit unda, sepulti.sepultus, -a, -um, adj.: buried
 Nec ripas datur horrendas et raucaraucus, -a, -um, adj.: loud, roaring fluentafluenta, -orum, n. pl.: river
 transportare prius quam sedibus ossaos, ossis, n.: bone quierunt.quiesco, -ere, quievi: rest
5Centum errant annos volitantquevolito, -are: fly haec litora circum.

Aeneid 6. 325-329

Translate the passage above as literally as possible.
